TopicTitle: 1.0.2 Make the game crash via the heating memory leak

Articles.Content:
Welcome Kerbonauts the challenge is to make the game crast the fastest due to the heating glitch. May the best kerbal win.

Rules

1. Stock only, I am not allowing any mods because mods may increase the amount of ram used.

2. You must provide screenshots or a video, and a craft file.

3. Computer must have mote than 4 gigabytes of ram

4. game would have to crash due to runnning out of ram

so... fastest to close to the sun?

It's a pity I didn't keep the save, but I had a fairly minimal Mk2 turbojet/lvl909 spaceplane that would consistently crash the game around the same speed/altitude every time last night once I hit he point where most of the parts on the ship had a temperature reading.
We adventurers like our wounds well salted...
Due to pc specs differing between users, I don't think this is entirely fair. Higher-end desktops, for example, should last longer than little laptops.

> 
> Due to pc specs differing between users, I don't think this is entirely fair. Higher-end desktops, for example, should last longer than little laptops.

\*pulls out netbook\* You all lose.

> 
> \*pulls out netbook\* You all lose.

I think you could win before you even get the game running, which proves my point. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
The Idea was that the game would crash due to running out ram.
The key to winning is to play another High-ram using game simultaneously, such as Space Engineers, leaving only couple hundred mbs for KSP.

Funny thing is, I tried to do this a few days back. Heated up a plane so much that it all glew orange (no, not the F11 overlay, the plane itself), turned on the heat gauges...

...RAM consumption went down by 20 MB. Guess I'll not be attending this one.
I can get KSP running flawlessly on my NOTEBOOK. Acer AspireOne from 2009, although it takes like a half hour to load, ald long load times between scenes. but once it's loaded it runs awesome.

> 
> 3. Computer must have mote than 4 gigabytes of ram

I'm pretty sure that only really old computers would have less than 4gb of ram these days.

Also, not much of a challenge IMO and theres lots of other factors that would come into play.

The temp bars don't have any negative effect for me.

Running OSX.... perhaps one of the few times I'm glad I haev a Mac... this seems to be a windows only problem as far as I can tell
I have not had any issues with the heat bars crashing my game.

This challenge is impossible.

I run linux. :/

As for fastest crash, I got the game to crash the millisecond I started it. So, ha!
